title: Japanese Pan Noodles Recipe
description: Toss udon noodles in a pan of broccoli, pepper, and zucchini stir-fry, coated with chili-garlic sauce to make this easy Japanese-style dish.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Japanese Japanese Pan Noodles 4.3 (18) 16 Reviews 3 Photos This is a great recipe to make any time. Lots of flavor. Top with cilantro and bean sprouts. Submitted by Kristen Wolfinbarger Updated on August 23, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 3 3 Prep Time: 25 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Total Time: 50 mins Servings: 4 Yield: 4 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 (10 ounce) package fresh udon noodles ½ teaspoon sesame oil, divided, or to taste 2 cups chopped broccoli ½ green bell pepper, cut into matchsticks 2 small carrots, cut into matchsticks, or to taste ½ zucchini, thinly sliced 2 tablespoons soy sauce 2 tablespoons mirin (Japanese sweet wine) 1 tablespoon chili-garlic sauce ¾ teaspoon minced ginger Directions Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook udon in boiling water, stirring occasionally, until noodles are tender yet firm to the bite, 10 to 12 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water. Stir in a few drops of sesame oil. Heat the remaining sesame oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook broccoli until bright green and still crunchy, about 5 minutes. Add green bell pepper and carrots; cook and stir until slightly softened, about 2 minutes. Add zucchini; cook until slightly softened, about 2 minutes more. Add soy sauce, mirin, chili-garlic sauce, and ginger; stir to combine. Mix in the noodles; cook and stir until noodles absorb some of the sauce, 1 to 2 minutes more. Cook’s Note You can use any vegetables; I like adding bamboo shoots, bok choy, and onion. You can also add any protein. Add Your Photo Photos of Japanese Pan Noodles 01 of 03 Photo by  Kristen Wolfinbarger 02 of 03 Photo by  Troy Mack 12/08/2023 I've been making it before Noodles and Company git a hold of it,but I make,all kinds of Chinese/Japanese, Vietnam,Evenly All Asian foods which I was taught by a Chinese Man back in the late 70's Especially Moo goo gai pan its an Americaniized version of a Cantonese dish,that's the best,I make atlease 10 times a month 03 of 03 Photo by  Kristen Wolfinbarger 07/23/2014 1 You’ll Also Love Chicken Yakisoba 195 Ratings Authentic Yakisoba 2 Ratings Soba Noodle Veggie Bowl 2 Ratings Teriyaki Shrimp and Vegetable Stir-Fry 7 Ratings Zaru Soba 4 Ratings Yakisoba Chicken 539 Ratings Jajangmyeon (Vegetarian Korean Black Bean Noodles) 1 Rating Mild Thai Beef with a Tangerine Sauce 6 Ratings Turkey Veggie Meatloaf Cups 878 Ratings Stir-Fried Japanese Ginger Pork 2 Ratings Chicken Hekka 26 Ratings Instant Pot Tonkotsu Ramen Broth 6 Ratings Tsukune (Japanese Chicken Meatballs) Pasta ai Fiori di Zucca (Pasta with Zucchini Blossoms) 3 Ratings Homemade Sushi 216 Ratings Lemon Orzo Primavera 202 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Kristen Wolfinbarger
instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook udon in boiling water, stirring occasionally, until noodles are tender yet firm to the bite, 10 to 12 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water. Stir in a few drops of sesame oil.;Heat the remaining sesame oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook broccoli until bright green and still crunchy, about 5 minutes. Add green bell pepper and carrots; cook and stir until slightly softened, about 2 minutes. Add zucchini; cook until slightly softened, about 2 minutes more. Add soy sauce, mirin, chili-garlic sauce, and ginger; stir to combine. Mix in the noodles; cook and stir until noodles absorb some of the sauce, 1 to 2 minutes more.
